thread.title: No. 2 BGM too much for C-M Tigerhawks
thread.title_full: No. 2 BGM too much for C-M Tigerhawks

title: No. 2 BGM too much for C-M Tigerhawks
text:
No. 2 BGM too much for C-M Tigerhawks Published: Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 11:35 a.m. CDT By Troy Hyde Newton Daily News 
COLFAX — Colfax-Mingo’s football team trailed 14-0 at halftime, lost all-state senior quarterback Jared Myers to an injury in the third quarter and were defeated for the first time since the season opener during a 35-0 loss to Class A No. 2 BGM on Friday. 
The Bears (8-0, 6-0) locked up the No. 1 seed out of District 7 after the win. 
Colfax-Mingo (6-2, 5-1) can do no worse than the No. 2 seed and ends the season next week with a trip to GMG. 
Colfax-Mingo came into the game averaging 41 points during its six-game win streak, but BGM’s had four interceptions and recorded a shutout for the fourth time in its last five district games. 
BGM’s offense rushed for 332 yards. Colton Massengale gained 180 yards and a touchdown on 34 carries and Dalton Jack rushed for 80 yards and two scores. 
Jayce Knight had four catches for 114 yards, including a 34-yard touchdown catch from Tanner Jansen. 
Myers finished 6-of-18 through the air for 80 yards and three interceptions before leaving with an injury in the third quarter. 
Colin Lourens had 77 yards on three catches for the Tigerhawks, who rushed for negative-11 yards. 
Jacob Lietz and Jacob Buehrer led the Colfax-Mingo defense with 11 and nine tackles, respectively. 
Alan Wheeler and sophomore Jarod Nichols each had 5.5 tackles. 
The Tigerhawks can finish the regular season 7-2 with a road win over Green Mountain-Garwin (1-7) Friday. 
That overall mark would be the best for Colfax-Mingo since the Tigerhawks went 9-1 in 2003, and the second most wins since the 1985 Colfax-Mingo merger.
